Key Match Events: Kylian Mbappe was involved in all three of France’s goals against Luxembourg, contributing to a 3-0 win.
Mbappe assisted the first goal by chipping the ball for Kolo Muani to head home.
Mbappe's off-the-ball run created space for Jonathan Clauss to score the second goal.
Mbappe scored the third goal, marking his 19th goal in 19 international games.
Pre-Game Insights: Kylian Mbappe expressed his happiness and relief after signing a five-year contract with Real Madrid, which he believes will positively impact his performance.
Mbappe emphasized the importance of getting back into shape and preparing for the Euros.
France manager Didier Deschamps highlighted the importance of Mbappe's leadership and the flexibility of the attacking line.
Post-Match Reflections: Didier Deschamps described Mbappe as a 'fantastic leader' and was satisfied with his performance.
Mbappe reflected on his past experiences, stating that the Euros are more complicated than the World Cup and that he has everything to prove in this tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: President Emmanuel Macron visited the French squad before their training session, with Mbappe standing in the front row.
